titlestmt.titleproper: Overview of the Paul Van der Stricht papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-05-12T16:25-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Declassified records description added to finding aid by Sarah Patton on 12 May 2015.

did.abstract: Correspondence, orders, memoranda, and maps relating to clandestine operations carried out by the Office of Strategic Services in German-occupied France during World War II, and to liaison with French resistance forces. Includes a short official history of operations carried out by the French resistance, and two draft chapters of a history of the Office of Strategic Services by William J. Casey.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Paul Van der Stricht papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1990.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Lieutenant colonel, United States Army; chief, Western European Section, Special Operations Branch, Office of Strategic Services, 1943-1944.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, orders, memoranda, and maps relating to clandestine operations carried out by the Office of Strategic Services in German-occupied France during World War II, and to liaison with French resistance forces. Includes a short official history of operations carried out by the French resistance, and two draft chapters of a history of the Office of Strategic Services by William J. Casey.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Office of Strategic Services.
controlaccess.subject: Secret service--United States.
World War, 1939-1945--France.
World War, 1939-1945--Secret service.
World War, 1939-1945--Underground movements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes two copies of a narrative (in French and the English translation) about the daylight operation of 14 July 1944 in the Department of Lot, as well as "A Short History of the Organization of the Command of Operations Undertaken by the French Forces of the Interior" (largely in English, but some pages in French).

did.unittitle: Rest of collection not yet described
